constituent: turn, dice, animal tracks, drop, rice, rice field, brains
heisigComment: * As a primitive element, we choose the image of a pair of dice which it is your turn to throw.
heisigStory: This key word has been chosen for its overlay of several meanings similar to those of the kanji: a turn of duty, a round, a number, and so forth. Its composite elements: animal tracks . . . rice field.
koohiiStory1: The famers take it in turns to watch out for any animal tracks on their rice field.
koohiiStory2: They take turns alternating between wheat and rice in this field…　　RTK2:　バン　電話番号　でんわばんごう(telephone number).
words:
下番(かばん): going off duty
番目(ばんめ): cardinal number suffix
順番(じゅんばん): turn (in line), order of things
当番(とうばん): being on duty
番地(ばんち): house number, address
留守番(るすばん): care-taking, caretaker, house-watching
番組(ばんぐみ): TV program
一番(いちばん): best, first, number one, a game, a round, a bout, a fall, an event (in a meet)
交番(こうばん): police box
番号(ばんごう): number, series of digits
